page.title: 12The Cross on the Hill.
page.content:
Beside the river Darent is the{War {Memorial}.It directs you to look up at the hill where there is a{cross cut {into the chalk.
If you walk through the village to the Recreation Ground,take the footpath to the Terrace and walk along it,then you will come to the cross. From there you can look back down and see{Shoreham village in the valley.
This landmark,which can be seen from miles around,was made by the villagers of Shoreham{in memory of the soldiers {who were killed in the First World War {(1914-1918)}.The cross measures 59m in length and 13m in width.
The sight of sheep and cattle grazing in the fields probably has not changed in hundreds of years.
